context.description: The context help for this user interface element could not be found.
This docks the perspective bar in different locations.
This toggles the visibility of the window toolbar and perspective bar.
This toggles whether text is shown for items on the perspective bar.
Bookmarks place an "anchor" at a specific line in a workbench resource.
Tasks place an "anchor" at a specific line in a workbench resource.
An incremental build compiles only the resources in the selected project that have been modified since the last build.
A full build compiles the resources in the selected project from scratch. This kind of build is only performed when a manual build is done.
An incremental build compiles only the resources that have been modified since the last build.
A full build compiles the entire workbench from scratch. This kind of build is only performed when a manual build is done.
This closes the selected resource.
This opens the selected resource.
This causes the selected resource to open in the editor area or in the specified external editor.
This opens a file system dialog that allows to open the selected files in the corresponding editor.
This causes the selected resource to open in the default system editor for this file type.
This refreshes the contents and display of the view.
This command allows you to move a resource from one location to another.
This command allows you to copy a resource from one location to another.
This command allows you to move a project from one location to another.
This command allows you to copy a project from one location to another.
This command allows you to supply a new name for the selected resource.
This command allows you to delete the selected resource.
This command deletes the selected resource or element.
This command displays the various properties of the selected resource.
This command displays the various properties of the project for the selected resource.
This command allows you to create a new folder container.
This command allows you to create a new file.
This command allows you to create a new item such as a resource.
This command allows you to import resources.
This command allows you to export resources.
The workbench is preparing for a build.
This menu option allows you to save the current perspective as a defined perspective.
This command allows you to save the resource being edited to another workbench location.
This command allows you to save all open resources in the editor area at once.
This command saves the resource that is currently active in the editor area.
This command displays product information.
This command closes all editors that are currently open in the editor area.
This command closes the active perspective.
This command closes the currently-active editor.
This command allows you to show or hide menu items and toolbar buttons.
This command allows you to customize the command groups available in the workbench menu bar and toolbar.
This command allows you to customize the shortcuts available in the New, Show Window and Show View menus.
This command allows you to delete or reset defined perspectives or to define the default perspective.
This closes all the perspectives that are currently open.
This opens the preferences dialog.
This opens a new window.
This will open the welcome editor.
This will open the tips and tricks help page.
This will save the workspace and exit.
This will reset the perspective to its original (default) layout.
This allows you to hide or show the editor area. You can increase the area other views have to display themselves when you hide the editor area.
This will show a view based on your selection.
Opens a dialog to select a view to show.
Opens the selected perspective.
Remove a bookmark.
Open resource in which a bookmark resides.
Select all bookmarks.
This command allows filtering of the types shown in the resource navigator.
Go to the selected resource.
Move the selected resource to another location.
Rename the selected resource.
Show the selected resource in the Project Explorer view.
Show property values grouped according to category.
Sets the value of the selected property to its default value.
Filter properties.
Remove all completed tasks from the list.
Create a new task.
Remove a task from this list.
Opens the resource associated with a task.
Undo the previous edit.
Redo the previous edit.
Cut the selected text to the clipboard.
Copy the selection to the clipboard.
Paste the contents of the clipboard at the current cursor position.
Delete the selection.
Select all contents of the file.
Shift selected text to the left, reducing the indentation.
Shift selected text to the right, increasing the indentation.
This will bring up a dialog to specify text to search for in the editor.
Add a bookmark on this resource.
Add a task associated with this resource.
Revert to saved contents.
Place cursor position at beginning of a specified line.
Opens an editor on a specified resource.
This command prints the resource that is currently active in the editor area.
Selects a working set from the list to be the active one.
Deselects the active working set.
Edits the contents of the active working set.
Shows the current selection in the specified view.
Moves forward in the navigation history.
Moves backward in the navigation history.
This dialog displays product information.

This dialog allows you to customize the menu items and toolbar buttons which are visible in a perspective. You can change which wizards, views and perspectives are listed in submenus, change the availability of command groups, and tweak the visibility of menu items and toolbar buttons.

topic.label: Showing and hiding menu items and toolbar buttons

context.description: In this dialog, you can associate various embedded and external editors with the various types of workbench resources.
In this dialog, indicate the extension for the file type you wish to identify.
This dialog allows you to set your workbench preferences.
This dialog allows you to view or change the properties of the selected resource.
This dialog allows you to save a perspective under a new name.
Dialog to select a perspective.
Dialog to select the location of a project.
Dialog to select a view to show.
Dialog to specify the name and location of the a resource to save.
Use this dialog to filter file types.
Dialog to select a folder.
Dialog to select a file.
Dialog to select an item from a list.
Dialog to accept, reject, or cancel a selection from a list.
Dialog to select a resource.
Dialog to select a resource to find in the workspace.
Dialog that allows you to show or hide tasks based on certain criteria.
Dialog to find and replace specified text.
Dialog to switch workspaces.
Dialog to open files by name or path.
A quick, simple guide to introduce new users to some basic tasks.
A text editor is used to edit files.
Shows the product configuration details.
On this preferences page, you can associate various embedded and external editors with the various types of workbench resources.
Allows you to change the order that projects in the workspace are built.
This preference page is used to configure the local file history for the workbench.
Allows you to set the state of existing perspectives.
This preference page is used to set preferences for the look and layout of views in the workbench.
This preference page is used to set the IDE-specific preferences settings related in workspace.
Allows you to set general workbench preferences.
This preference page is used to set the fonts used within the workbench.
This preference page is used to set the key bindings used within the workbench.
This preference page is used to set preferences for the editor area in the workbench.
This preference page is used to set preferences relating to workbench capabilities.
This preference page is used to set preferences relating to resource content types.
Allows you to set referenced projects.
Allows you to view information about the selected resource.
Allows you to view path variables and linked resources in the project
Allows you to view path variables in the workspace
Allows you to view and configure resources filters on a project or folder
Allows you to create and edit resources filters
Allows you to create and edit resources filters
View to show all bookmarks.
View to show the outline (if applicable) of a resource being edited.
This view shows all resources in the workspace.
This view shows the properties of a selected resource.
This view shows tasks (reminders) that are either user-created or are automatically generated during building.
This view shows problems that are generated during building.
The Properties view displays the properties of the selected resource.
Views can be undocked from a workbench window and can exist in floating windows on the desktop.
Each workbench window contains one or more perspectives, which are made up of various views and editors.
This wizard helps you create a new project in the workbench.
This wizard page allows you to select other projects which this project will reference.
Wizard to guide you through creation of a new folder resource.
This dialog allows to create a new folder in the file system.
Wizard to guide you through creation of a new file resource.
Choose the type of resource you would like to create.
Choose the type of export you would like to do.
Choose the type of import you would like to do.

topic.label: Importing resources with the Import Wizard

context.description: This page helps you to provide all the information required to export resources to the file system.
This page helps you to provide all the information required to import files from the file system.
This page helps you to provide all the information required to export resources from the workspace to an archive file.
This page helps you to provide all the information required to import files from an archive file into the workspace.
This page helps you to provide all the information required to export preferences from the workspace to a file system.
This page helps you to provide all the information required to import preferences from a file system into the workspace.
These wizards allow you to create new resources and/or elements
Opens a creation wizard.
Wizard to assist in creating a new file resource.
Wizard to assist in creating a new folder resource.
Wizard to assist in creating a new project.
Wizard to assist in importing resources.
Wizard to assist in exporting resources.
Displays the menu for the active view.
Displays the Switch to Editors dialog.
Cut the selected text to the clipboard.
Copy the selection to the clipboard.
Paste the contents of the clipboard at the current cursor position.
Select all contents.
Delete the selection.
Cut the selected text to the clipboard.
Copy the selection to the clipboard.
Paste the contents of the clipboard at the current cursor position.
Delete the selection.
This will bring up a dialog to specify text to search for in the editor.
Select all contents.
Undo the previous edit.
Redo the previous edit.
This dialog allows you to add, remove, or configure working sets for use within the workbench. A working set is a subset of the workspace.

This dialog asks you to confirm whether or not you wish to delete the selected project, and if so, whether you wish to also delete the underlying project files on the local file system corresponding to your project.
This dialog allows you to select from a list of possible resolutions.
This dialog displays all open editors, allowing you to conveniently choose those you wish to close or save.
This dialog allows you to one of the set of available welcome pages. Welcome pages can help you get started using particular parts of the workbench.
This page allows you to specify which decorators you would like to be displayed on items within the workbench. Decorators give you more information about an item, at the expense of visual clutter.
This page shows you all of the plug-ins that are activated when the workbench starts.
This page allows you to control the prompting to select a workspace when the workbench starts.
This wizard will guide you through the process of creating a working set.
This wizard will guide you through the process of editing a working set.
Displays a dialog to allow you to select filters to isolate specific elements of the workspace only.
Marks the currently selected task as 'complete'.
Displays a dialog to allow you to select from a list of possible resolutions.
Selects all tasks in the task view.
Displays a dialog to allow you to set properties for the selected task.
Move back one frame.
Move forward one frame.
Drill down into selected element
Move up one frame.
Locks the toolbars within the workbench.
This dialog shows details about all installed plug-ins.
This dialog shows details about all plug-ins within a particular feature.
This dialog shows details about all installed features.
This page allows you to choose the resources that will be part of your working set.
This page allows you to select the type of working set you want to create.
Copies the selected bookmark to the clipboard.
Pastes the bookmark(s) on the clipboard.
Displays a dialog to allow you to set properties for the selected bookmark.
Sorts bookmarks in ascending order.
Sorts bookmarks in descending order.
Sorts bookmarks by description.
Sorts bookmarks by resource.
Sorts bookmarks by folder.
Sorts bookmarks by location.
Sorts bookmarks by creation time.
Copies the selected resource to the clipboard.
Pastes the resource on the clipboard to the location of the currently selected resource.
Copies the selected property to the clipboard.
Copies the selected task to the clipboard.
Paste the contents of the clipboard at the current cursor position.
This dialog allows you to set properties for the selected task.
Sorts tasks by type.
Sorts tasks by completion.
Sorts tasks by priority.
Sorts tasks by description.
Sorts tasks by resource.
Sorts tasks by folder.
Sorts tasks by location.
Sorts tasks by creation time.
Sorts tasks in ascending order.
Sorts tasks in descending order.
Opens the system menu of the active view or editor.
Displays a menu which allows you navigate forward through the currently open views.
Displays a menu which allows you navigate backward through the currently open views.
Displays a menu which allows you navigate forward through the currently open editors.
Displays a menu which allows you navigate backward through the currently open editors.
Displays a menu which allows you navigate forward through the currently open perspectives.
Displays a menu which allows you navigate backward through the currently open perspectives.
Activates the editor pane.
This command navigates back to the last edit location.
Selects the next annotation in the resource that is currently active in the editor area.
Selects the previous annotation in the resource that is currently active in the editor area.
This command converts the file to use classic MacOS line delimiters (CR).
This command converts the file to use Unix/MacOS X line delimiters (LF).
This command converts the file to use Windows line delimiters (CRLF).
This command enters the incremental find previous mode or goes to the previous match if already in incremental mode. Esc quits the incremental find mode.
This command deletes the text form the current caret position to the beginning of the line.
This command deletes the text from the current caret position to the end of the line.
This command sets a mark in the editor.
This command finds the next match in the editor.
This command cuts the whole line to the clipboard.
This command deletes the whole line.
This command cuts the text from the current caret position to the end of the line to the clipboard.
This command joins the selected lines or appends the next line if the selection is empty.
This command clears the previously set mark in the editor.
Swaps the current curet position with the previously set mark.
This command enters the incremental find mode or goes to the next match if already in incremental mode. Esc quits the incremental find mode.
This command finds the previous match in the editor.
This command cuts the text from the current caret position to the beginning of the line to the clipboard.
This command sets the encoding to US-ASCII.
This command sets the encoding to ISO-8859-1.
This command sets the encoding to UTF-8.
This command sets the encoding to UTF-16 (big-endian).
This command sets the encoding to UTF-16 (little-endian).
This command sets the encoding to UTF-16.
This command sets the encoding to the current system encoding.
This command sets the encoding to the default encoding.
This command allows to set a custom encoding.
This preference page is used to set preferences for the text editor.
On this page you can configure the text editor's accessibility preferences.

On this page you can indicate your spelling preferences.
Hint: If your preferred language is not available as Platform dictionary choose none and then search the internet for a word list with the words of your preferred language and set it as User defined dictionary.
This command opens content assist.
This command shows content assist context information.
This command provides quick assists and quick fixes.
This command displays information for the current caret location in a sticky hover.
This command allows to show whitespace characters in the editor.
This command toggles the block (aka column) selection mode in the editor.
The Templates view shows the templates for the active editor.
This view displays the current state of background processes.
This dialog allows you to open a feature specific tips and tricks page.
This command displays the help view. The help view contains help books, topics, and information related to the workbench and installed components.
This command displays the help view opened on the search page.
This preference page is used to set preferences for launching Web browsers from the workbench.
This dialog allows you to modify the properties of an externally launched browser.

This view allows you to display web pages. By default, it is used to display web pages when they are opened from the workbench. You can modify this setting in the Web Browser preferences available from the link below.
This dialog allows you to customize how a file and folder hierarchy is recreated in a project.

context.title: Project Explorer View Customization Dialog
context.description: This dialog allows you to set filters and select content for the Project Explorer.

context.title: Project Explorer
context.description: The Project Explorer allows you to navigate the contents of your workspace.
Opens a hyperlink at the current caret location.
The error log view captures warnings and internal errors thrown by the internal platform or your code.
This dialog shows detailed information about a logged event.
This dialog allows you to filter the Error Log view.
The tracing preference page allows you to dynamically change the tracing options of plug-ins and output settings.
The UI Responsiveness Monitoring preference page allows you to enable automatic detection of UI freezes and to modify parameters affecting freeze detection and logging.
Allows you to configure Bidi and other globalization preferences.
